pyntacle.graph_generator.graph_igraph_generator module¶

Generator classes of undirected graphs with known topologies. Envisioned models are: Erdos-Renyi, Scale-free, Tree and Small-world

class BarabasiAlbertGenerator[source]¶

Bases: object

Class generator of Erdos-Renyi-based random graphs with a specified number of nodes and a probability of wiring

generate(parameters)[source]¶

It generates a graph based on the Barabasi-Albert model

Parameters:parameters – List of two parameters. 1: (int) the number of vertices, 2: (int) the number of outgoing edges
Returns:The generated igraph.Graph object
class ErdosRenyiGenerator[source]¶

Bases: object

Class generator of Erdos-Renyi-based random graphs with a specified number of nodes and a probability of wiring

generate(parameters)[source]¶

It generates a random graph based on the Erdos-Renyi model

Parameters:

parameters – List of two parameters. 1: (int) the number of vertices, 2: a(float) if specifying the probability of nodes connection, else an (int) if specifying the number of edges
Returns:

The generated igraph.Graph object
Raises:
  • TypeError – if the type of the input parameters is not correct
  • ValueError – if the value of the input parameters is not correct
class SmallWorldGenerator[source]¶

Bases: object

Class generator of Watts_Strogatz -based random graphs with a specified dimension of the lattice, the size of the lattice along all dimensions, a value giving the distance (number of steps) within which two vertices will be connected and a rewiring probability

generate(parameters)[source]¶

It generates a graph based on the Watts_Strogatz model

Parameters:parameters – List of 4 parameters. 1: (int) the dimension of the lattice, 2: (int) the size of the lattice along all dimensions, 3: (int) value giving the distance (number of steps) within which two vertices will be connected, 4: (float) rewiring probability
Returns:The generated igraph.Graph object
class TreeGenerator[source]¶

Bases: object

Class generator of a Tree with a specified number of nodes and children of each node

generate(parameters)[source]¶

It generates a tree in which almost all vertices have the same number of children

Parameters:parameters – List of two parameters. 1: (int) the number of vertices, 2: (int) the number of children of a vertex in the graph
Returns:The generated igraph.Graph object
randomword(length)[source]¶
